Parameters: long: millisecond representing the initial delay.
setInitialDelay(long).Description: Sets the initial delay. Progress bar will be shown after this delay has elapsed.

Parameters: View: custom view that will be shown to indicate progress.
setProgressBarView(android.view.View).Description: Sets a custom view to be shown in place of the default @B_android#widget#ProgressBar_E@. This view must have a parent. Once set, we maintain the visibility property of this view.

Parameters: ViewGroup: view that will contain the progress bar.
setRootView(android.view.ViewGroup).Description: Sets the root view on which the progress bar will be attached. This class assumes the root view to be @B_android#widget#FrameLayout_E@ in order to position the progress bar widget in the center of the screen.

ClassDesc: Manager for showing/hiding progress bar widget. This class lets user specify an initial delay after which the progress bar will be shown. This is currently being used in @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#BrowseFragment_E@ & @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#VerticalGridFragment_E@ to show https:##developer#android#com@B_android#widget#ProgressBar_E@ while the data is being loaded.
